text: it was the key moment in our evolution
when apes became human our ancestors
came down from the trees to become the
species that dominated the planet and we
now know it began here in Ethiopia 2.8
million years ago researchers discovered
this jawbone they believe it belongs to
one of the very first humans I do think
this is truly a momentous moment in
understanding human evolution because we
now really understand where and when the
first human lived and how it evolved and
this is what the first human might have
looked like it had a small brain and was
just a meet at all but over millions of
years some think it evolved to become us
and one of the key differences between
Apes and humans were the teeth at the
front is the skull of a chimpanzee you
can see that it has large teeth and
powerful jaws now compare it with that
of an early human it seems that as we
evolved a teeth grew smaller as we
learned how to use tools and our brains
became larger
the first humans emerged at a time when
the climate became warmer forests were
replaced by vast African plains and some
Apes came down from the trees there were
changes going on that were were causing
these creatures to spend more time on
the ground and developing a of
perfection if you are walking upright
which which came later on there
beginning that process the first humans
evolved because of a change in the
Earth's climate and it was a moment that
changed the world
Paula Ghosh BBC News
